Temporary Danbury Branch Schedule Begins Sat., March 1

A temporary Danbury schedule will be in effect starting Saturday, March 1, until further notice, to provide a more reliable service while contractors for Metro-North and the Connecticut Dept. of Transportation (ConnDOT) work to resolve the problem with the new grade crossing system. This problem has necessitated “Stop and Warn” procedures to ensure safe train movements past each crossing, resulting in delays. The schedule will include time adjustments for most weekday peak-period trains as well as substitute busing for weekday off-peak and weekend service. For more information, visit http://tinyurl.com/lf8tthl

No Train Service to/from Greenport Mon. Feb. 17

The LIRR is operating on a weekend/holiday schedule on Presidents' Day, Mon. Feb. 17th. There is no service between Greenport & Ronkonkoma that day. As an alternative, East of Ronkonkoma customers can use the Montauk Branch. Off-Peak fares will be in effect all day.
No Train Service on West Hempstead Br. Mon. Feb. 17

The LIRR is operating on a weekend/holiday schedule Presidents' Day, Mon. Feb. 17th. There is no service on the West Hempstead Branch that day. As an alternative, West Hempstead Branch customers can use the Hempstead, Lynbrook, Valley Stream or Merillon Avenue stations (all located in Fare Zone 4).
Weekend/Holiday Schedule Presidents' Day, Feb 17 - Extra Ronkonkoma Train

The LIRR is operating on a weekend/holiday schedule Presidents' Day, Monday, Feb. 17th. An extra train departs Ronkonkoma Monday at 7:10AM, making all local stops to Hicksville, then Jamaica, Woodside, and Penn Station. Off-Peak fares will be in effect all day.

Weekend/Holiday Schedule Presidents' Day, Feb 17 - Extra Ronkonkoma Train

The LIRR is operating on a weekend/holiday schedule Presidents' Day, Monday, Feb. 17th. An extra train departs Ronkonkoma Monday at 7:10AM, making all local stops to Hicksville, then Jamaica, Woodside, and Penn Station. Off-Peak fares will be in effect all day.
No Train Service on West Hempstead Br. Mon. Feb. 17

The LIRR is operating on a weekend/holiday schedule Presidents' Day, Mon. Feb. 17th. There is no service on the West Hempstead Branch that day. As an alternative, West Hempstead Branch customers can use the Hempstead, Lynbrook, Valley Stream or Merillon Avenue stations (all located in Fare Zone 4).
No Train Service to/from Greenport Mon. Feb. 17

The LIRR is operating on a weekend/holiday schedule on Presidents' Day, Mon. Feb. 17th. There is no service between Greenport & Ronkonkoma that day. As an alternative, East of Ronkonkoma customers can use the Montauk Branch. Off-Peak fares will be in effect all day.

Metro-North to Operate Reduced Service Today

Today, Thursday, Feb. 13, Metro-North will operate reduced service due to the winter storm with some local and express trains that serve adjacent stations being combined and making additional stops. See details at http://tinyurl.com/n2dkpw5 . See the schedules page at http://tinyurl.com/6akjw for train times. This service plan represents 75% of our regular service and is based on projected lower ridership and our efforts to minimize the effects of the storm on our equipment and infrastructure. The combined trains were chosen to minimize customer impacts and to get customers to their destination within 10-15 minutes of their normal time. Customers should take care when traveling during inclement weather and allow for additional travel time. Please use caution when entering and exiting trains, and on platforms and staircases. Also check the www.mta.info/mnr or news media for updates, listen for station announcements and download the Metro-North Train Time App for iPhone and Android users

On Thursday, Feb. 13 Metro-North to Operate Reduced Service

For Thursday, Feb. 13, Metro-North will operate reduced service due to the winter storm with some local and express trains that serve adjacent stations being combined and making additional stops. See details at http://tinyurl.com/n2dkpw5 . See the schedules page at http://tinyurl.com/6akjw for train times. This service plan represents 75% of our regular service and is based on projected lower ridership and our efforts to minimize the effects of the storm on our equipment and infrastructure. The combined trains were chosen to minimize customer impacts and to get customers to their destination within 10-15 minutes of their normal time. Customers should take care when traveling during inclement weather and allow for additional travel time. Please use caution when entering and exiting trains, and on platforms and staircases. Also check the www.mta.info/mnr or news media for updates, listen for station announcements and download the Metro-North Train Time App for iPhone and Android users.

An Explanation for This Morning's Power Issue

At approximately 9:40 AM, a tripped circuit interrupted the power that feeds our catenary (overhead wire) system in the vicinity of Cos Cob, the location where we are currently replacing two transformers. Crews were able to restore power within 10 minutes to our overhead catenary system. This event had minimal impact on service, and the work to replace the transformers remains on schedule. We regret any inconvenience you may have experience as a result of this short disruption.

An Explanation Regarding the Danbury Branch Signalization Project

A new signal system project for the entire Danbury Branch was completed by the Connecticut Department of Transportation and Metro-North in November. As a result, Branch Line service was expanded, allowing for the ability to operate more than one train along the corridor at a time. Recently, a problem with the newly installed computerized train detection system that controls the grade crossings was identified. Despite the fact that this system was comprehensively tested at each crossing prior to being activated along the right-of-way, the mechanism that controls the opening and closing of a gate crossing sometimes activates with no trains approaching. We are working on finding a permanent fix. In the meantime, we have modified the system’s operation and have put into place a procedure to operate trains safely. See full details at http://tinyurl.com/lk4n95q

For the PM Peak, Wed., Feb. 5, Metro-North will operate with some local and express trains that serv

For the PM Peak, Wed., Feb. 5, Metro-North will operate with some local and express trains that serve adjacent stations, being combined and making additional stops. This service plan represents 75% of our regular service and is based on lower ridership counts and our continuing efforts to protect our equipment due to the impact of the winter storm. The combined trains were chosen to minimize customer impacts and to get customers home within 10-15 minutes of their normal time. After 9 PM tonight, Metro-North will start hourly service on all lines for the duration of the night. For Thursday, Feb. 6, Metro-North anticipates operating regular service. Most of Metro-North's service territory is under a foot of snow and overnight temperatures are expected to be in the single digits. Because of the continued extreme winter weather, the railroad may experience weather-related problems. See more details at See http://tinyurl.com/n2dkpw5 . Use our interactive schedules page at http://tinyurl.c

This service change was initially scheduled for 9:45 AM to 3 PM, Wed to Fri, Feb 5 - 7, but has been scaled back due to Winter weather.

The “All You Need to Know” About Metro-North App Has Arrived

LIRR Service Advisory for Feb. 5 Storm

The LIRR reminds customers that icing conditions are possible today. Please use extra caution on platforms/stairs and allow extra travel time to get to your station. While we are running on a normal weekday schedule today, Wed., Feb. 5, temporary service suspensions are possible due to icing conditions, downed power lines and/or trees. As always, signing up for our free email alerts and downloading the LIRR Train Time app is best way to stay informed.

Regular Off-Peak Schedule in Effect on the Hudson & Harlem Lines

Metro-North is operating a Regular Off-Peak Schedule on the Hudson & Harlem Lines today, Wednesday, February 5 . Use our interactive schedules page at http://tinyurl.com/6akjw for train times. Metro-North customers should anticipate possible delays and crowded conditions on trains due to the impact of the winter storm on our service territory. Please continue to listen to announcements at your station and on board trains for any service changes. Be sure to continue to check www.mta.info and listen to the media for updates. Also take care when traveling during inclement weather and allow for additional travel time. Customers should use caution when entering and exiting trains, and on platforms and staircases.
Metro-North Will Operate Hourly Service on the New Haven Line Beginning at Noon

New Haven Line trains will operate on an hourly schedule due to significant weather-related problems with the overhead catenary wire beginning at 12 Noon. Hourly service will begin with the following trains: Inbound to NYC (46 minutes after the hour from New Haven; on the hour from Stamford The 11:46 AM from New Haven making all stops to Stamford, then operating express to Harlem-125th St Station and Grand Central Terminal The 12:00 PM from Stamford making all stops to Grand Central Terminal Outbound from NYC (8 minutes after the hour to New Haven; 34 minutes after the hour to Stamford) The 12:08 PM from Grand Central Terminal operating express to Stamford and then making all stops to New Haven The 12:34 PM from Grand Central Terminal making all stops to Stamford. Use our interactive schedules page at http://tinyurl.com/6akjw for train times, or see a printed timetable.
